channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023111265
item.description:
Report X-2023111265

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF LEAKAGE. THE STEEL DRUM OF ISOPROPANOL WAS FOUND WITH A HOLE ON THE SIDE CAUSING IT TO LEAK. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE HURRIDLY PLACE IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ISOPROPANOL CAUSED FROM IT BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENT WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION UNLESS OTHERWISE.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. ONE BOTTLE OF 70% ISOPROPL ALCOHOL WAS FOUND WITH THE CAP LOOSE CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT HALF WAY. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE HURRIDLY PLACE IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: AILURE OF THE PACKAGE CAUSED FROM IT BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION UNLESS OTHERWISE.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipping box crushed while in transit causing four of six Sunnyside Xylene 1Gal cans to become same. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box crushed while in transit causing four of six Sunnyside Xylene 1Gal cans to become same. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT cage for further processing.

FURTHER INSPECTION SHOWED ONE BOTTLE OF RAPICIDE HAD A PUNCTURE IN THE BOTTOM CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT HALF WAY. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED.   • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE BOX ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE WITH THE CONTENTS MISSING.THE BOX WAS PLACED INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE AWAITING CONTENTS TO SHOW UP AFTER A FEW DAYS BUT NONE OF MISTY OVEN AND GRILL CLEANER DID. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF PACKAGE MISTY OVEN AND GRILL CLEANER CAUSED FROM IT BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACE IN THE HAZMAT TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023111166
item.description:
Report X-2023111166

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: NOBLE CHEMICAL ADAVANTAGE CHEMICAL DELIMER 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES, ONE BOTTLE HAD A PUNCTURED HOLE ON THE SEEM ON OF THE BOTTLE AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 100% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023110857
item.description:
Report X-2023110857

  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING SIZZLE SCALE REMOVER DETARANT WAS FOUND WITH 1 OF THE BOTTLES DAMAGE. THE BOTTLE WAS SLIGHTY LEAKED OUT. THEY WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO THE CAP OF SIZZLE SCALE REMOVER DETARANT BEING LOOSE CAUSING 1 BOTTLE OF TO BE DAMAGED. ( LEAKING) DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

DescribePack: Inspection of "SUNNYSIDE MURIATIC ACID" showed package to be wet, torn, with internal leakage, from a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a plastic salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2023110908
item.description:
Report X-2023110908

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: KEASBEY

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART A AND 2X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT PART B AND PART A EACH HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING LEAKAGING ALLOWING 8 OUNCES OF SPILLAGE FROM EACH BOTTLE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023110628
item.description:
Report X-2023110628

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with stains. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 glass bottles containing Acetonitrile was found cracked and leaked out. The contents were placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to the glass bottle cracking and leaking out, most likely due to a conveyer mishap when being unloaded. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The remaining glass bottles were secured in a salvage drum to avoid breakage to the unbroken bottles. the broken glass will be disposed of properly.

item.title: Report X-2023110599
item.description:
Report X-2023110599

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with orange stains. Upon inspection, a plastic bottle containing Epredia Orange G-6 was found with a loose cap causing some leakage. Items were placed in a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: Package failure was due to a loose cap with no seal causing a leakage of about 1/4 of the solution. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately inspected and lids were secure tightly.

item.title: Report X-2023110598
item.description:
Report X-2023110598

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with the closures open and previous wet conditions. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 of the plastic bottles containing "Ethyl Alcohol" was found with a loose cap and about almost half of the reagent leaked out. Items were placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap with no seal causing almost half of the ethyl alcohol reagent to leak out. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately inspected, Lids on the bottles were secured tight, and the contents were placed into a salvage drum upright to await disposition.

  • Description: The passenger came to FA in the aft galley concerned because he spilled some liquid on the device and the device went on. The passenger was not smoking nor was the device. However, the pilots asked my colleague who manage the situation to place the device in the TCB as prevention. Device would not turn off.

item.title: Report I-2023090078
item.description:
Report I-2023090078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: REPUBLIC AIRWAYS HOLDINGS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Per report from United Alrlines Sr Manager Airport Ops (Olivia Boles), UA3612 YUL arrived to C109 at 18:39, while crew was downloading the flight, they noticed a bag was smoking. They moved it away from the aircraft and called ARFF and Police. Upon inspection they found melted wet swimwear in the bag along with an air tag in a plastic bag. Phone 732.306.0228, olivia.boles@united.com I have asked for a report and not received one. but the Deputy fire chief reported the following: "ARFF did respond and the call originated from the EWR PAPD desk. On arrival it was found that a bag had been damaged from heat or fire. Rescue 8 and Truck 4 responded which is typical outside of an alert dispatched by EANS. Upon investigation the ARFF crew found an Apple Air Tag overheating (tracking device) that also caused several wet bathing suits to melt in addition to the damaged bags. These tags have a lithium based battery and exposure to ater causes these thermal type events." I also reached out to the customer [REDACTED BY GEM/DATA OPS], who sent me pictures of the air tag (which was returned to her on site), it did not appear damaged and functioned normally. She also indicated the air tag was not on the side of the bag where the melteg hole was located. Phone [REDACTED BY GEM/DATA OPS]
